case_vignette:
A 67-year-old-male farmer presents complaining of a growing mole on the right side of his cheek.   He states the mole was present for several years, but then started growing rapidly on one side a few weeks ago. Sometimes the mole will bleed on its own. He tries to avoid picking at the area.   Physical examination shows tan-brown ovoid irreuglarly shaped hyperpigmented macule with focal ulcearion. Dermoscopy demonstrates a blue-gray veil in the center of the lesion.   The patient is concerned about the possibility of melanoma.   The patient has a history of multiple sunburns and a history of smoking.   The patient is a 67-year-old male who has been a farmer for 40 years.   The patient has a history of multiple sunburns and a history of smoking.   The patient is concerned about the risk of melanoma.   The patient has a history of multiple sunburns and a history of smoking.   The patient is a 67-year-old who has been a farmer for 40 years.   The patient has a history of multiple sunburns and a history of smoking.   The patient is concerned about the risk of melanoma.
Original Text: 
A 67-year-old-male farmer presents complaining of a growing mole on the right side of his cheek.   He states the mole was present for several years, but then started growing rapidly on one side a few weeks ago. Sometimes the mole will bleed on its own. He tries to avoid picking at the area.   Physical examination shows tan-brown ovoid irreuglarly shaped hyperpigmented macule with focal ulcearion. Dermoscopy demonstrates a blue-gray veil in the center of the lesion.   The patient is concerned about the possibility of melanoma.   The patient has a history of multiple sunburns and a history of smoking.   The patient is a 67-year-old male who has been a farmer for 40 years.   The patient has a history of multiple sunburns and a history of smoking. question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a growing mole on the right side of my cheek that sometimes bleeds on its own.
How long have you had this mole and when did you first notice changes in it?
The mole has been present for several years but started growing rapidly on one side a few weeks ago.
Have you noticed any changes in the color or texture of the mole?
Yes, the mole has developed a tan-brown color with an irregular shape and there's a part that looks like a sore.
Do you have a family history of skin cancer or similar skin conditions?
I don't have any information about my family history of skin cancer or similar skin conditions.
Have you experienced any weight loss, night sweats, or fatigue recently?
No, I haven't experienced any weight loss, night sweats, or fatigue recently.
Final Diagnosis: Malignant Melanoma.
